revised_title: A Study on the Structure and Growth of Echinus Tooth
tldr: The author investigates the structure and growth of the Echinus tooth, describing its complex formation and comparing it to the incisor tooth of Rodent mammals. The study reveals the unique microstructure of the tooth, which is made up of various calcareous elements and has similarities to the shells of some mollusks. The author also discusses the process of calcification and the role of soldering particles in the formation of the tooth's cavitary structure.
